Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Reverse relationships:

Parameters:

choice (Reverse ForeignKey from Choice) – All choices of this question (related name of question)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

choice_set

Type: Reverse ForeignKey from Choice

All choices of this question (related name of question)

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager

get_next_by_pub_date(*, field=<django.db.models.DateTimeField: pub_date>, is_next=True, **kwargs)

Finds next instance based on pub_date. See get_next_by_FOO() for more information.

get_previous_by_pub_date(*, field=<django.db.models.DateTimeField: pub_date>, is_next=False, **kwargs)

Finds previous instance based on pub_date. See get_previous_by_FOO() for more information.

Views

polls.views.detail(request, question_id)[source]

Displays the details of a specific question.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • question_id – The ID of the question to retrieve.

Returns:

Rendered HTML template displaying the question details.

Raises:

Http404 – If the question does not exist.

polls.views.index(request)[source]

Displays the latest five questions in the polls.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered HTML template displaying the latest questions.

polls.views.results(request, question_id)[source]

Displays the results of a specific question.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • question_id – The ID of the question whose results are to be displayed.

Returns:

Rendered HTML template displaying the results of the question.

Raises:

Http404 – If the question does not exist.

polls.views.vote(request, question_id)[source]

Processes the vote for a specific question.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • question_id – The ID of the question being voted on.

Returns:

Redirects to the results page after processing the vote.

Raises:

  • Http404 – If the question does not exist.

  • KeyError – If no choice is selected.
